page.title: 09HADNOCK FARM _ 2
page.content: The busy times of the year are: 1){Lambing}_ This starts around {Christmas}and finishes in{March.}The lambs are sold in May_July. Dipping is done by the farmer but shearing is done by contractors who can shear 280 sheep a day.The wool is sold in{ {Abergavenny. } 2){Grain Harvesting}_ This occurs in{August_september}and is highly mechanised. The combines run from 09.30 to 20.30. The 200 acres yield 400 tons of grain. The straw is sold locally by auction. 3){Haymaking}_ This occurs in { {June}and 5,000 bales are made from 50 acres. Although machines can cut, turn, bale and pick up, the hay still has to be moved and stacked properly by hand. There is a danger of fire,collapse and rot.{Silage}is not made because it could cause pollution.
